decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help support the aggro strategy by providing additional damage and control. The inclusion of Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory adds versatility and disruption to the deck. Additionally, Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial offer removal and protection when needed. The mana base is well balanced to support the deck's aggressive playstyle.

This deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo by using cards that allow for explosive mana ramping and searching for key combo pieces. It aims to quickly and efficiently play Primeval Titan, utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and Gruul Turf for extra mana advantage. The deck also includes tools for protection and searching for specific cards, allowing the player to set up the combo and win the game in a powerful and strategic manner.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The deck utilizes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Redirect Lightning to deal damage to the opponent's life total while also using creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to attack efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Voice of Victory and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to pump up the creatures and provide additional value. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on using powerful instant-speed reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to cheat out big creatures like Griselbrand and Solitude from the graveyard. It also employs disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces. Additionally, cards like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending provide card advantage and flexibility. This deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats. By utilizing a mix of graveyard recursion, control elements, and card advantage, it aims to outpace and outmaneuver its opponent in a fast-paced Modern format.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, alongside efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Consign to Memory, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain control of the game. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional support for the aggressive strategy, while cards like Scion of Draco and Teferi, Time Raveler offer versatility and disruption. Overall, the deck is built to quickly establish dominance and close out games swiftly.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Basking Broodscale with Blade of the Bloodchief, creating a powerful threat that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple to ramp into its threats, while controlling the board with removal spells like Malevolent Rumble and Unholy Heat. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Vexing Bauble and Soul-Guide Lantern to disrupt the opponent's plans, making it a versatile and adaptable combo deck in the Modern format.

The focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures like Quantum Riddler and Flickerwisp, while also taxing their resources with cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler. By playing aggressively with Overlord of the Balemurk and Emperor of Bones, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending helps to control the board and maintain a tempo advantage. Overall, this deck seeks to disrupt, tax, and aggro down the opponent efficiently.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. The deck utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory to control the board and slow down the opponent's progress. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Solitude to close out the game once the opponent's resources are depleted. By controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent, the deck aims to secure victory through a combination of board control and card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Aggro strategy combined with Death and Taxes elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through powerful creatures and spells. By deploying disruptive cards like Quantum Riddler and Solitude, along with efficient removal spells like Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to control the board and outpace the opponent. With powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, the deck can quickly close out games and secure victory. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of control elements and card advantage to maintain tempo and consistency.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler. It also includes key creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to provide additional threats on the board. The deck also has a land base that includes various dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own win conditions through powerful creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing creatures and disrupting the opponent with burn spells and counterspells. It aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while also using Leyline of the Guildpact to pump up its creatures. The deck also includes cards like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to control the board and protect its threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around applying pressure early and maintaining board presence to secure a quick victory.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creature plays with efficient burn spells to control the board and finish off opponents quickly. The deck utilizes low-cost creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Monastery Swiftspear alongside powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to put pressure on the opponent. Cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Slickshot Show-Off provide card advantage and flexibility in gameplay. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with swift, aggressive plays while maintaining control with efficient removal spells.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal. It also utilizes creatures with disruptive abilities like bouncing or tapping down enemy threats. The key strategy is to control the game by denying the opponent resources and threats while gradually building card advantage and preserving life total. Wan Shi Tong, Librarian acts as a card advantage engine, providing access to additional resources. The deck's win condition is to outvalue the opponent with efficient removal and disruption spells while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana with cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion to cast powerful spells such as Grapeshot and Ral, Monsoon Mage. It also utilizes cards like Valakut Awakening and Wish to dig for combo pieces and Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard. The goal is to create a storm of spells to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single turn. The deck includes cards like Desperate Ritual and Reckless Impulse to help build towards the explosive combo turns.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, as well as burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to provide additional power and versatility. Arena of Glory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional utility and advantage. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive nature of the deck, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost artifacts to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to generate additional mana and card advantage, along with synergies like Urza's Saga and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to create a powerful and fast board state that can quickly end the game. With an emphasis on efficient artifact creatures and powerful Artifact cards, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and win through sheer aggression and card advantage.
